channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Deep pot holes sending stoned over cars outside number 15, 1st April
item.description:
The problem has got worse with the rain
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11 Whittington Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shurdington Main Road, 31st March
item.description:
The recently modified road gully is blocked causing flooding to the Main Road and potential damage to adjacent properties
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Tyning Cottage Shurdington Road, Shurdington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 31st March
item.description:
Drain needs opening

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 237-239 High Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wide and deep holes, 31st March
item.description:
The potholes are really deep and I’m worried they’ve damaged my car. You can’t avoid them even by swerving, so it is really dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Barnett Way, Barnwood
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road gullies blocked, 31st March
item.description:
Despite having reported flooding issues with blocked road drains over the last 6 years. Gloucestershire Council repeatedly advise that the problem has been resolved. The flooding causes my property to be affected and I am basically at the point of refusing to pay my council tax until it is remedied
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 53 Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several potholes, 31st March
item.description:
Runnings the whole length of PE Way many large potholes
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 4 Princess Elizabeth Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several large potholes, 31st March
item.description:
Spread out between two hedges road and delabere road.

item.title: Pothole at School entrance, 31st March
item.description:
There are two large/deep potholes at the entrance to a school. Hard to avoid due to cars being parked on the other side of the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 44 East End Road, Charlton Kings

item.title: Old fence panels dumped, 30th March
item.description:
After recent private fence replacement, the old panels have been dumped by the footpath. A council fence alongside the path was dismantled and needs to be repaired.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 29 Glynrosa Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large & deep potholes along Cudnall St in 3 places, 30th March
item.description:
Large, deep potholes along Cudnall Street that can’t be avoided due to cars parked along the street. Please fix! They are damaging cars and have been there for a long time.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 7 Cudnall Street, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More potholes than road surface, 30th March
item.description:
They did the other side of the road a few months ago. Will cause an accident one day. Difficult to avoid without driving on the wrong side of the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Wagers Court Balcarras Road, Charlton Kings
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large deep pothole, 30th March
item.description:
This is a wheel damaging hole

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 10 Pirton Lane, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road closure signs left behind, 30th March
item.description:
Mini roundabouts - junctions of Hatherley Road / Shelburne Road / Alma Road. Red warning signs on ALL approaches to mini roundabouts (at least 4 signs) left behind from recent road closures (completed a month ago). ALL need removing - why are they still in place a month after the works were completed and road roads re-opened???

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 83 Hatherley Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bins and recycling bins on pavement, 30th March
item.description:
Residents bins stored on pavement allowing rubbish to be blown around, could be stored in front garden like other residents.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 18 Saint Pauls Walk, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
